content.text: Sketch the graph of \(y = |3 + 5x|\), showing the coordinates of the points where your graph meets the coordinate axes
Solve the equation \(\left|3 + 5x\right| = 2.\)
Find the values of \(k\) for which the line \(y = k - 6x\) is a tangent to the curve \(y = x(2x + k)\).
Given that \(p = \log_q 32\), express, in terms of \(p\),
Using the substitution \(u = 5^{x}\), or otherwise, solve
\(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x}\) ,
the approximate change in \(y\) when \(x\) increases from \(\frac{\pi}{4}\) to \(\frac{\pi}{4} + p\), where \(p\) is small. \quad
Given that \(y = \frac{x^2}{\cos 4x}\), find
Find the first 3 terms, in descending powers of \(x\), in the expansion of \(\left(x + \frac{2}{x^2}\right)^6\)
Hence find the term independent of \(x\) in the expansion of \(\left(2 - \frac{4}{x^3}\right)\left(x + \frac{2}{x^2}\right)^6\).
Show that \(3\sqrt{5} - 2\sqrt{2}\) is a square root of \(53 - 12\sqrt{10}\)
State the other square root of \(\) 53 - 12\sqrt{10}\)
Express \(\frac{6\sqrt{3} + 7\sqrt{2}}{4\sqrt{3} + 5\sqrt{2}}\) in the form \(a + b\sqrt{6}\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers to be found
Do not use a calculator in any part of this question
Find the coordinates of \(C\)
The point \(D\) lies on the \(y\)-axis and the line \(CD\) is perpendicular to \(AC\)
Find the area of the triangle \(ACD\)
The points \(A(-3, 6), B(5, 2)\) and \(C\) lie on a straight line such that \(B\) is the mid-point of \(AC\)
Find the range of \(\mathrm{g}\)
Find \(\mathrm{g}^{-1}(x)\)
Write down the domain of \(\mathrm{g}^{-1}(x)\)
Solve \(\mathrm{g}^{2}(x) = 3\)
A function g is such that \(\mathrm{g}(x) = \frac{1}{2x - 1}\) for \(1 \leqslant x \leqslant 3\)
Using the graph paper below, plot a suitable straight line graph to show that, for \(10^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 80^{\circ}\),
Use your graph to find the value of \(A\) and of \(B\)
Estimate the value of \(y\) when \(x = 50\)
Estimate the value of \(x\) when \(y = 12\)
The table shows values of the variables \(x\) and \(y\)
Solve \(\csc \left(2x - \frac{\pi}{3}\right) = \sqrt{2}\) for \(0 < x < \pi\) radians
Given that \(5(\cos y + \sin y)(2\cos y - \sin y) = 7\), show that \(12\tan^2 y - 5\tan y - 3 = 0\).
Hence solve \(5(\cos y + \sin y)(2\cos y - \sin y) = 7\) for \(0^{\circ} < x < 180^{\circ}\)
Find the coordinates of each of \(A, B\) and \(C\)
Find the area of the shaded region
The diagram shows part of the graph of \(y = (12 - 6x)(1 + x)^2\), which meets the \(x\)-axis at the points \(A\) and \(B\). The point \(C\) is the maximum point of the curve
the equation of the curve,
the \(x\)-coordinate of \(A\) and of \(B\),
the area of the shaded region

The diagram shows part of a curve such that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = 3x^2 - 6x - 9\). Points \(A\) and \(B\) are stationary points of the curve and lines from \(A\) and \(B\) are drawn perpendicular to the \(x\)-axis. Given that the curve passes through the point (0, 30), find
Answer only one of the following two alternatives
